revised_title: Concordance of Mammalian Ejaculate Features: A Comparative Analysis
tldr: This study investigates the relationship between different measures of ejaculate characteristics, such as volume, proportion of normal sperm, proportion of motile sperm, and total number of sperm per ejaculate, and their impact on the probability of fertilization in mammals. The author found that these characteristics are positively related and have evolved in the same direction, suggesting that improvements in one trait are generally associated with improvements in other ejaculate traits. This indicates that there is a common selective force driving the evolution of these characteristics to increase the probability of fertilization and male reproductive success.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Reproductive Biology
